definitions.definition: Fiscal year
Containing or characterized by a covalent bond.
The system that provides support to an organism, internal and made up of bones and cartilage in vertebrates, external in some other animals.
An anthropomorphic representation of a skeleton.
definitions.example: She dressed up as a skeleton for Halloween.

definitions.definition: A very thin person.
definitions.example: She lost so much weight while she was ill that she became a skeleton.

definitions.definition: The central core of something that gives shape to the entire structure.
definitions.example: The skeleton of the organisation is essentially the same as it was ten years ago, but many new faces have come and gone.

definitions.definition: A frame that provides support to a building or other construction.
A client-helper procedure that communicates with a stub.
definitions.example: In remote method invocation, the client helper is a ‘stub’ and the service helper is a ‘skeleton’.

definitions.definition: The vertices and edges of a polyhedron, taken collectively.
A very thin form of light-faced type.
(attributive) Reduced to a minimum or bare essentials.
To reduce to a skeleton; to skin; to skeletonize
To minimize
A type of tobogganing in which competitors lie face down, and descend head first.
The state of being inconsistent.
An incompatibility between two propositions that cannot both be true.
An expression of disdain, disbelief, protest, or dismissal; a huff, grunt, or snort.
definitions.example: Give the governor a harumph.

definitions.definition: To dislike, protest, or dismiss.
An expression of disdain, disbelief, protest, refusal or dismissal.
definitions.example: Harumph! She is welcome to try, but I'm not going to bother helping.

definitions.definition: To become detached or to drop from.
definitions.example: A button fell off my coat.

definitions.definition: To diminish in size, value, etc.
definitions.example: Business always falls off in the winter.

definitions.definition: To change the direction of the sail so as to point in a direction that is more down wind; to bring the bow leeward.
A thin film of oil floating on the surface of water, especially one that has leaked or been discharged from a ship etc
A short speech, spoken directly at the audience at the end of a play
The performer who gives this speech
A brief oration or script at the end of a literary piece; an afterword
A component of a computer program that prepares the computer to return from a routine.
To conclude with an epilogue.
Of, or relating to heraldry or heralds.
(of a person) Intoxicated by alcohol.
(of a person) Inclined to consume a significant amount of alcohol.
(of an event) Involving a large consumption of alcohol.
definitions.example: We all had hangovers after a boozy weekend in town.

definitions.definition: (of food) Containing or cooked with alcohol.
definitions.example: For dessert, the hosts treated us to a helping of boozy apple pie.

definitions.definition: Something that is not workable, or cannot be made to work.
Not workable or operable; not practical; unmanageable.
A passage; a way through.
A road open at both ends or connecting one area with another; a highway or main street.
The act of going through; passage; travel, transit.
An unobstructed waterway allowing passage for ships.
One who sneaks.
An athletic shoe with a soft, rubber sole.
A vessel of drink.
A sneaker male.
An open field designated for the taking off and landing of aircraft, but which, unlike an airport, does not necessarily have terminals or paved runways.
A minor offence, petty crime
A violation; breach
A major violation of rules which leads to a penalty, if detected by the referee.
A gallery, platform, or balcony, usually roofed and often partly enclosed, extending along the outside of a building.
A small, slender knife or dagger-like weapon intended for stabbing.
A rapier.
An awl.
A woman's shoe with a tall, slender heel (called a stiletto heel).
A beard trimmed into a pointed form.
To attack or kill with a stiletto (dagger).
Sharp and narrow like a stiletto.
definitions.example: Her stiletto heels would cause damage if she ever stepped on someone's foot with them.

definitions.definition: A state in which person in the military performs military duties on a full-time basis, as opposed to reserve, where one only occasionally performs military duties.
definitions.example: Sandie, the naval officer, left work because she had been called to active duty.

definitions.definition: A male pupil or student.
A male graduate.
A student of any gender.
A graduate of any gender.
A narrow roadway; a lane
A pass made in a backward direction.

The transfer of the radar identification of an aircraft from one controller to another when the aircraft enters the receiving controller's airspace and radio communications with the aircraft are transferred.
The passing of a completed project to another person or group.
The act of pushing an opponent away with an open hand.
The transfer of control to another subsystem.
A type of financial institution which traditionally was based on lending money (as mortgages) to society members to buy houses, from other members pooled savings and/or money borrowed wholesale.
The act of experimenting; practice by experiment.
A set of actions and observations, performed to verify or falsify a hypothesis or to research a causal relationship between phenomena.
Any of the three species of spiny-finned freshwater fish in the genus Perca.
Any of the about 200 related species of fish in the taxonomic family Percidae, especially:
Several similar species in the order Perciformes, such as the grouper.
A rod, staff, or branch of a tree etc used as a roost by a bird
A pole connecting the fore gear and hind gear of a spring carriage; a reach.
A position that is secure and advantageous, especially one which is prominent or elevated
A position that is overly elevated or haughty
A linear measure of 5 1/2 yards, equal to a rod, a pole or 1/4 chain; the related square measure
A cubic measure of stonework equal to 16.6 × 1.5 × 1 feet
A frame used to examine cloth
A bar used to support a candle (especially in a church)
Any of the three species of spiny-finned freshwater fish in the genus Perca.

Several similar species in the order Perciformes, such as the grouper.

A frame used to examine cloth
A bar used to support a candle (especially in a church)
To rest on (or as if on) a perch; to roost.
definitions.example: The macaw was perched on Jim's shoulder.

definitions.definition: To stay in an elevated position.
To place something on (or as if on) a perch.
To inspect cloth using a perch.
Hopelessly outdated
definitions.example: What am I supposed to do with this neolithic piece of machinery?

definitions.definition: A form of art in which the artist creates a live performance, often using a variety of media.
A young person attending school or of an age to attend school.
A tracklisting; a list of tracks appearing on an album, EP, LP etc.
To propel (a boat or other craft) over water using oars.
To transport in a boat propelled with oars.
definitions.example: to row the captain ashore in his barge

definitions.definition: To be moved by oars.
definitions.example: The boat rows easily.

definitions.definition: To argue noisily
The action of the verb to row.
The action of propelling a boat with oars.
The rowing of boats as a competitive sport.
The act of having a row, or argument.
Material used on the outside of a roof, such as shingles.
A way of travel which consists in clambering over the roofs of skyscrapers.
To cover or furnish with a roof.
To traverse buildings by walking or climbing across their roofs.
To put into prison, to bird.
To shelter as if under a roof.
A guard, especially in a prison.
A truncheon or staff carried by a king or commander, used to signal commands.
The abnormal termination of operation of a superconducting magnet, occurring when part of the superconducting coil enters the normal (resistive) state.
A rapid change of the parameters of a physical system.
To satisfy, especially an actual or figurative thirst.
definitions.example: The library quenched her thirst for knowledge.

definitions.definition: To extinguish or put out (as a fire or light).
To cool rapidly by dipping into a bath of coolant, as a blacksmith quenching hot iron.
definitions.example: The swordsmith quenched the sword in an oil bath so that it wouldn't shatter.

definitions.definition: To terminate or greatly diminish (a chemical reaction) by destroying or deforming the remaining reagents.
To rapidly change the parameters of a physical system.
The set of yarns placed crosswise in a loom, interlaced with the warp, carried by the shuttle; weft.
A fabric; the texture of a fabric.
The sound a dog makes when barking.
To make a woofing sound.
The sound of a dog barking.
Expression of strong physical attraction for someone.
Initialism of well-off older folks.
Initialism of work on an organic farm.
A member of an evangelical church
An advocate of evangelicalism
Pertaining to the doctrines or teachings of the Christian gospel or Christianity in general.
Pertaining to the gospel(s) of the Christian New Testament.
Protestant; specifically Lutheran and Calvinist churches in continental Europe as well as their offshoots in North America.
Pertaining to a movement in Protestant Christianity that stresses personal conversion and the authority of the Bible (evangelicalism).
Pertaining to Islamic groups that are dedicated to dawah and preaching the Quran and sunnah.
Zealously enthusiastic.
A current of air, usually coming into a room or vehicle.
Draw through a flue of gasses (smoke) resulting from a combustion process.
An act of drinking.
The quantity of liquid (such as water, alcohol, or medicine) drunk in one swallow.
definitions.example: She took a deep draft from the bottle of water.

definitions.definition: A dose (of medicine, alcohol, etc.)
Beer drawn from a cask or keg rather than a bottle or can.
Depth of water needed to float a ship; depth below the water line to the bottom of a vessel's hull; depth of water drawn by a vessel.
An early version of a written work (such as a book or e-mail) or drawing.
definitions.example: His first drafts were better than most authors' final products.

definitions.definition: A preliminary sketch or outline for a plan.
A cheque, an order for money to be paid.
Conscription, the system of forcing people to serve in the military.
definitions.example: He left the country to avoid the draft.

definitions.definition: A system of forcing or convincing people to take an elected position.
A system of assigning rookie players to professional sports teams.
The pulling force (tension) on couplers and draft gear during a slack stretched condition.
The bevel given to the pattern for a casting, so that it can be drawn from the sand without damaging the mould.
(possibly obsolete) The action or an act (especially of a beast of burden or vehicle) of pulling something along or back.
definitions.example: using oxen for draft   shot forth an arrow with a mighty draft

definitions.definition: (possibly obsolete) The act of drawing in a net for fish.
(possibly obsolete) That which is drawn in; a catch, a haul.
definitions.example: he cast his net, which brought him a very great draft

definitions.definition: A quantity that is requisitioned or drawn out from a larger population.
To write a first version, make a preliminary sketch.
To draw in outline; to make a draught, sketch, or plan of, as in architectural and mechanical drawing.
To write a law.
To conscript a person, force a person to serve in some capacity, especially in the military.
definitions.example: He was drafted during the Vietnam War.

definitions.definition: To select someone (or something) for a particular role or purpose.
definitions.example: There was a campaign to draft Smith to run for President.

definitions.definition: To select and separate an animal or animals from a group.
definitions.example: The calves were drafted from the cows.

definitions.definition: To select a rookie player onto a professional sports team.
definitions.example: After his last year of college football, he was drafted by the Miami Dolphins.

definitions.definition: To follow very closely (behind another vehicle), thereby providing an aerodynamic advantage to both lead and follower and conserving energy or increasing speed.
To draw out; to call forth.
To draw fibers out of a clump, for spinning in the production of yarn.
A checker: a game piece used in the game of draughts.
Ale: a type of beer brewed using top-fermenting yeast.
A mild vesicatory.
An outhouse: an outbuilding used as a lavatory.
Any picture or drawing.
A sudden attack upon an enemy.
The small hammer-shaped bone of the middle ear.
definitions.example: A fracture of the malleus handle is a rare traumatic middle ear lesion.

definitions.definition: The tripus (ossicle in cypriniform fishes).
One of the paired calcareous structures within the mastax of rotifers.
A decrepit motor car.
Anything which is in poor condition or of poor quality.
(often with "up") To make or become lively; to enliven; to animate.
Full of liveliness and activity; characterized by quickness of motion or action
definitions.example: We took a brisk walk yesterday.

definitions.definition: Full of spirit of life; effervescing
Sparkling; fizzy
definitions.example: brisk cider

definitions.definition: Stimulating or invigorating.
definitions.example: This morning was a brisk fall day. It wasn't cold enough for frost, but you wanted to keep moving.

definitions.definition: Abrupt, curt in one's manner or in relation to others.
A small board with keys primarily used for tactile input into a machine.
definitions.example: Many laptop computers have special function keys which turn part of the alphabetical keyboard into a numeric keypad.

definitions.definition: An author who collaborates with another to write something.
To write something in collaboration with another author.
An expert on mathematics.
In a downward direction

definitions.definition: To lose or remove water; to dry
A geometric shape with four angles and four straight sides; a four-sided polygon.
A courtyard which is quadrangular.
The buildings forming the border of such a courtyard.
A person who sells tobacco, cigarettes, cigars, snuff and sundry items.
A tobacconist's shop.
A person who is addicted to smoking tobacco.
The edible immature mucilaginous seed pod (properly, capsule) of the Abelmoschus esculentus.
The flowering mallow plant Abelmoschus esculentus itself, now commonly grown in the tropics and warmer parts of the temperate zones.
A small carriage in which a baby or child is pushed around; a stroller or baby buggy
Abbreviation of circa.
definitions.example: The document was written in the Middle Ages, c. 1250.

definitions.definition: The middle tone in either one of the sets of seven white keys on a keyboard or a set of seven strings on a stringed instrument.
(stative) To perceive or detect with the eyes, or as if by sight.
To form a mental picture of.
(social) To meet, to visit.
To be the setting or time of.
definitions.example: 1999 saw the release of many great films.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To ensure that something happens, especially while witnessing it.
definitions.example: I'll see you hang for this!  I saw that they didn't make any more trouble.

definitions.definition: To wait upon; attend, escort.
definitions.example: I saw the old lady safely across the road.

definitions.definition: To respond to another player's bet with a bet of equal value.
definitions.example: I'll see your twenty dollars and raise you ten.

definitions.definition: To determine by trial or experiment; to find out (if or whether).
definitions.example: I'll come over later and see if I can fix your computer.

definitions.definition: (used in the imperative) To reference or to study for further details.
definitions.example: For a complete proof of the Poincaré conjecture, see Appendix C.

definitions.definition: To examine something closely, or to utilize something, often as a temporary alternative.
definitions.example: Can I see that lighter for a second? Mine just quit working.

definitions.definition: To include as one of something's experiences.
definitions.example: The equipment has not seen usage outside of our projects.

definitions.definition: A person who boils something.
A steam boiler.
An apparatus for heating circulating water or other heat transferring liquid.
A device consisting of a heat source and a tank for storing hot water, typically for space heating, domestic hot water etc., disregarding the source of heat.
A kitchen vessel for steaming, boiling or heating food.
A sunken reef, especially a coral reef, on which the sea breaks heavily.
A tough old chicken only suitable for cooking by boiling.
Boilerplate.
The act of unlocking something.
To undo or open a lock or something locked by, for example, turning a key, or selecting a combination.
definitions.example: I unlocked the door and walked in.

definitions.definition: To obtain access to something.
definitions.example: I unlocked the dictionary article so I could edit it.

definitions.definition: To disclose or reveal previously unknown knowledge.
definitions.example: The discovery of a clue unlocked the mystery.

definitions.definition: To be or become unfastened or unrestrained.
A group of businesses or nations that collude to limit competition within an industry or market.

definitions.definition: A combination of political groups (notably parties) for common action.
A written letter of defiance or challenge.
An official agreement concerning the exchange of prisoners.
A ship used to negotiate with an enemy in time of war, and to exchange prisoners.
A specification of the energy and probability density of an electron at any point in an atom or molecule.
An orbital motorway.
Of or relating to an orbit.
Of or relating to the eye socket (eyehole).
(roads, railways) passing around the outside of a certain area.
definitions.example: The M25 is an orbital motorway around London.

definitions.definition: To comport (oneself); to behave.
To evict, especially from a country.
To continue or proceed as before.
definitions.example: I'll be gone for a few days, but I hope you will carry on in my absence.

definitions.definition: To take baggage or luggage onto an airplane, rather than check it.
definitions.example: You may only carry on items that are smaller than a certain size.

definitions.definition: To have or maintain.
definitions.example: It is difficult to carry on a conversation with so many distractions.

definitions.definition: To act or behave; especially to misbehave so as to attract attention.
definitions.example: I really wish you wouldn't carry on like that in public!

definitions.definition: To have an illicit sexual or flirtatious relationship.
definitions.example: I thought he was my friend, but all the time he was carrying on with my wife!

definitions.definition: The small prominent bone of the cheek.
One of several kinds of bird in the family Corvidae
A superficially similar Australian bird, Gymnorhina tibicen or Cracticus tibicen.
Someone who displays a magpie-like quality such as hoarding or stealing objects.
A fan or member of Newcastle United F.C.
The 3rd circle on a target, between the inner and outer.
A halfpenny.
To mark with patches of black and white or light and dark.
To steal or hoard (items) as magpies are believed to do.
To talk idly; to talk about other people's private business.
Initialism of feet per second.
A list of terms in a particular domain of knowledge with their definitions.
To evade, or escape from someone or something, especially by using cunning or skill
To shake off a pursuer; to give someone the slip
To escape understanding of; to be incomprehensible to
A dish made by fermenting finely chopped cabbage.
A German person.
A gastrointestinal disorder characterized by frequent and very fluid or watery bowel movements.
The watery or very soft excrement that comes from such bowel movements.
A polyhedron with six faces. The regular hexahedron is the cube, and is one of the Platonic solids.
To make blissful.
To pronounce or regard as happy, or supremely blessed, or as conferring happiness.
To carry out the third of four steps in canonization, making someone a blessed.

A dog from a group of small, lively breeds, originally bred for the hunting of burrowing prey such as rats, rabbits, foxes, and even otters; this original function is reflected in some of their names (e.g. rat terrier).
A collection of acknowledgments of the vassals or tenants of a lordship, containing the rents and services they owed to the lord, etc.
An inventory (book or roll) in which the lands of private persons or corporations are described by their site, boundaries, number of acres, etc.; a terrar.
An auger or borer.
A musical instrument, like the various accordions, that is a member of the free-reed family of musical instruments, typically having buttons on both ends.
Something resembling a concertina, such as a folded book, a bus door or a set of picture frames that are folded together.
Coiled barbed wire for use as an obstacle.
A type of booklet label, consisting of up to 32 pages of booklet as an insert.
To become compressed into a shape reminiscent of a concertina

definitions.definition: To be drawn closer and farther apart repeatedly, or up and down, as if situated on a working concertina's folds
A fast foxtrot noted for its complex and intricate footwork.
To dance the quickstep.
To move with a hurried step.
Of a colour which resembles brown; somewhat brown.
In a dismal manner.
One who gardens; one who grows plants or cultivates a garden.

definitions.definition: A fellow sailor serving on the same ship as another.
Any sailor (when used as a form of address by a sailor).
A person or horse that competes in show jumping.
Fart
Accompanied by wind.

definitions.definition: Unsheltered and open to the wind.

definitions.definition: Empty and lacking substance.

definitions.definition: Long-winded; orally verbose.
Flatulent.
Nervous, frightened.
(of a path etc) Having many bends; winding, twisting or tortuous.
(underwater diving) Underwater swimming using scuba equipment.
A verification of the factuality of specific information.
To verify the factuality of specific information.
To lose strength, become weaker; to wane; to disappear or reduce slowly.
definitions.example: I was angry at first, but my rage faded away over time.

definitions.definition: One who performs for, or entertains, an audience.
One who performs or does anything.
definitions.example: the performer of an action

definitions.definition: A fuel derived from petroleum (or other oils) but heavier than gasoline/petrol. Used to power diesel engines which burn this fuel using the heat produced when air is compressed.
A vehicle powered by a diesel engine.
A rider who has an even energy output, without bursts of speed.
Snakebite and black (a drink).
A particular cannabis hybrid.
To ignite a substance by using the heat generated by compression

For a spark-ignition internal combustion engine to continue running after the electrical current to the spark plugs has been turned off. This occurs when there's enough heat in the combustion chamber to ignite the air and fuel mixture without a spark, the same way that heat and pressure cause ignition in a diesel engine.
definitions.example: The only reason the VW bug has a solenoid is to prevent it from dieseling.

definitions.definition: Having an unregulated body temperature; ectothermic.
Lacking emotion or compunction.
A clear, deep, red variety of corundum, valued as a precious stone.
A red spinel.
A deep red colour.
The tincture red or gules.
The size of type between pearl and nonpareil, standardized as 5½-point.

A red bird-of-paradise, Paradisaea rubra.
To make red; to redden.
Of a deep red colour.
A pronunciation guide written above or beside Chinese or Japanese characters.

Having been given an advantage, such as by biased referees in a competition.
